availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry F. Falls (Lawrence County, Pennsylvania, laborer and captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Lawrence County, Pennsylvania, laborer and captain (U.S.A.). Pennsylvania native. Married to Lucetta Falls. Father of Henry C. Falls, Clara Falls, and Ishmael Falls. Day laborer in Lawrence County, Pennsylvania, in 1860. Served in the 53rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from September 22, 1864 to September 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Lawrence County, Neshannock, p. 142.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Lawrence County, New Castle Ward 2, p. 159A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 522.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0456.
